com.dotsandboxes.game.controllers

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dotsandboxes.game.controllers.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Game class object responsible for handling the game as it develops. It interfaces the game state and keeps track of the board, notifies the game listeners and indicated when a turn has changed.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Game.Mode
      Enumeration of the Mode which the user has selected to play as.
      static class  Game.Player
      Enumeration of the players, who own a square.
      static class  Game.State
      Enumeration for the game state.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game(int rows, int columns)
      Basic default constructor setting initial values to zero and placing PLAYER1 as the next to move.

      • Game

        public Game(int rows,
            int columns)
        Basic default constructor setting initial values to zero and placing PLAYER1 as the next to move.
        Parameters:
        rows - the rows of the board
        columns - the columns of the board

        public Board getBoard()
        The getter for the board object
        Returns:
        the current board on which the game is played

      • makeAMove

        public int makeAMove(int dotStart,
                     int dotEnd)
        Connects two dots on the board, which counts as a move. This method keeps track of the current state of the game.
        Parameters:
        dotStart - starting point
        dotEnd - ending point
        Returns:
        how many boxes were completed. -1 if the move is invalid.
